title: Program Transaction Schema
description: Establishes the transaction interface that programs use apply mutations/generate analytics.

mutations.title: Mutations
mutations.description: These are actions we would like to be performed by the program engine (i.e. creating a reward or sending an email)

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.description: A list of analytics representing activities performed by the program

user.title: Mutation User
user.description: The mutation will be applied to this user

type.title: Mutation Type
type.description: The type of mutation to be performed

key.title: Reward Key
key.description: The program template key used to establish the relationship between this reward and the program

rewardId.title: Reward ID
rewardId.description: A unique BSON ObjectID used to identify the reward, if not set this will be auto-generated. Use this to link with emails.

referralId.title: Referral ID
referralId.description: The referral ID for the event to be marked as a source of this reward

status.title: Initial Reward Status
status.description: This status defines the state the reward will be in when immediately after it is created

key.title: Event Key
key.description: The key of the event to be marked as a source of this reward

id.title: Event ID
id.description: The unique identifier of the event to be marked as a source of this reward

dynamicProperties.title: If the reward is marked as dynamic by the program template these properties will be used to dynamically generate the reward. TODO describe user definition precedence?

overrideProperties.title: Reward Override
overrideProperties.description: Properties included here will override or be added to properties setup via program reward configuration

dateScheduledFor.title: Scheduled Reward Given Date
dateScheduledFor.description: If the reward is created in a PENDING state this is the date we will attempt to 'give' it

dateExpires.title: Reward Expiry Date
dateExpires.description: The date this reward is scheduled to expire if the reward is expirable

graphNodeType.title: Graph Node Type
graphNodeType.description: The type of the graph node(s) to be moderated

filter.title: Moderation Filter
filter.description: A GraphQL filter that defines the node(s) to be moderated. See RewardFilterInput, ProgramEmailTransactionFilterInput, ProgramReferralFilterInput, and UserEventDataFilterInput

action.title: Moderation Action
action.description: The moderation action to apply to the filtered graph node(s)

maxDepth.title: Max Depth
maxDepth.description: The maximum depth of child nodes to be moderated

key.title: Email Key
key.description: The program template key of the email to send

status.title: Email Status
status.description: The initial email status, if not set this will default to QUEUED

rewardId.title: Email Reward ID
rewardId.description: If included this defines the reward that will be available in the email render context

query.title: Email Query
query.description: The GraphQL query used to build the context for this email

queryVariables.title: Email Query Variables
queryVariables.description: This variables object parameterizes the GraphQL Email query

eventType.title: Event Type
eventType.description: The type of event to record as an analytic

data.title: Event Data
data.description: Event data - currently just program which only requires the user

programType.description: The type of program (i.e. acquisition, loyalty, retention)

analyticsKey.description: The type of analytic recorded (i.e. in program goals this could describe the goal achieved such as 'friendPaid')

analyticsDedupeId.description: An ID unique in the recording of this analytic that will be used to deduplicate (i.e. with goals this could be the number of times the referrer was rewarded)

timestamp.description: The date this analytic will be marked as recorded (defaults to current tenant time if not set)
